poem:
Title: "Frugality's Paradox"

Coupon Lady spun her thrifty fable,
Worth five grand on the YouTube table.
A debt dancer on TV screens,
In reality, behind the scenes,
Found herself in financial strife,
Her advice bled empty of life.
Who'd believe, endowing trust,
That her own purse, it gathers dust?
A paradox, rich yet flimsy,
This cautionary tale of frugality's whimsy.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I was offering great advice but I wasn’t following it’: the personal finance guru who spiralled into debt “I used to be known as the coupon lady,” says Lauren Cobello, 43, who commanded $5,000 per YouTube video as a personal finance influencer. “I was a regular on the Today show and Good Morning America, I was blogging, working with newspapers. I had no financial background but I’d got my family out of $40,000 debt by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
